First, the question suggests that John did everything that was required of him while examining the corpse.<n>2. The text also suggests that despite doing everything that was required, he still missed the real cause of death.<n>3. Given this context, John's examination was not lacking in care, thought, completeness, or intricacy as these are not necessarily related to missing information.<n>4. However, the examination missing the real cause of death suggests that it wasn't comprehensive or detailed enough.<n>5. In this context, being 'thorough' implies that he would have taken more time to carefully check every aspect of the examination.<n>6. Therefore, D: thorough is the correct answer. The missing element in John's examination was thoroughness. Had he been more thorough, he would have discovered the real cause of death.<n>So the final answer is D: thorough<n><n>Input:Where would you dispose of a broken icebox? Choices:  A: antique store B: in the graveyard C: kitchen D: junk yard E: ice<n>Output:		You would be able to get rid of a broken icebox in an antique shop. The word choice to dispose means to sell, or to dispose of something. You’d be able to sell the item for money. You could also say that you’re going to dispose off the icebox.<n>An answer choice is incorrect when I do something is used with a negation. For example: Do not take anything with you when you go. It means that you are not allowed to take anything with you when going; it does not mean that you are allowed to take anything with and therefore the answer choice You would not be able to get rid is incorrect. A better choice here is You will be able to get rid. The word would indicates that it will be possible in the future. There is no indication that a broken icebox would not be able to be disposed off.<n><n>Input: I wish she had done her chores a long time ago.  <n>Choices:  A. That's too late to do. B. Too late to do. C. Too late. D. Too late to. E: Too bad.<n>Output: Since 'a long time ago' refers to 'an earlier point in time' ('long time ago refers to the past'), that gives us a clue that Too late refers to the past. 'Do her chores' refers to an activity in progress, or a task not yet complete. 'Too late' refers to a later time, which means that there is still time for 'to do her chores'. Therefore, 'That's too late to' is incorrect. 'Too late to do.' is incorrect because the phrase 'do her chores' is being used in the third person (she has done her chores), so she should be the subject of the verb, not the object. Also, 'late' describes 'to do' which should not be the object; it should be the main verb. 'Too late.', 'Too late to.' and 'Too late to.', is incorrect because 'late' is not an adverb, but a noun, thus describing something, not adding to the meaning of the adverb. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Too Bad'.<n>So the final answer from above is E: too bad.<n><n>Input: A. That’s too late to be.<n>Choice: B:	That’s too late
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Output: 1. First, the question suggests that John did everything that was required of him while examining the corpse.<n>2. The text also suggests that despite doing everything that was required, he still missed the real cause of death.<n>3. Given this context, John's examination was not lacking in care, thought, completeness, or intricacy as these are not necessarily related to missing information.<n>4. However, the examination missing the real cause of death suggests that it wasn't comprehensive or detailed enough.<n>5. In this context, being 'thorough' implies that he would have taken more time to carefully check every aspect of the examination.<n>6. Therefore, D: thorough is the correct answer. The missing element in John's examination was thoroughness. Had he been more thorough, he would have discovered the real cause of death.<n>So the final answer is D: thorough<n><n>Input:Where could you find a theater which only has unpaid actors? Choices:  A: shopping mall B: hospitals C: populated area D: school E: military base<n>Output:		1: Here'shopping mall' is meant literally. You'd be more likely to find unpaid actors in the actual shopping mall.<n>2: A 'hospital' generally would not allow unpaid theatre performances on its premises, but if something really special came along, say a good fundraiser or something, a hospital might make an exception and allow theatre performances for free.<n>3: On the other hand, you might see an unpaid play in a very rural or remote area where there's so few amenities, that people do what they have to in order to get by- like put on a free play in the school the town/city council funds.<n>Though this is a remote possibility at best.<n>4: It would be a stretch to say an unpaid play could find a home in a military base.<n>5: So the final answer is A: shopping malls<n>

The center barrel fires the bullet, while the other barrels help the bullet to speed. While all four are used in shooting, only two are used in firing. So, how many barrels does a pistol contain? Only when one of the barrels fires the bullet does it use a barrel in firing.<n>6. So, two barrels are used for firing a pistol.<n>7. And, since a pistol has one that has one or more barrals, the answer to the question is A: One

Now let us understand why. The given line is in simple present tense, present perfect tense or the perfect tense of the given sentence can be 'have become' The sentence talks about the wood which became fossilized. To check this, we can replace the sentence with, 'The wood 'have become' fossilized' so. 'The wood 'have became' fossilized', using the present perfect tense. This sentence is correct. As the sentence can not be changed with any tense other than perfect tense. So, we can use'have become' instead of fossilized. Therefore, petrification is correct.<n>So the final the final answer is C: warp<n><n>input: We don't need to use a lot of resources, the food is on earth. Choices:  A B C D E<n>Output:1. Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n>Output:		The explorers found a large passageway, with a large room on the end.   I would argue that D: large building is not the intended answer because the explorers found a room in the final passageway. The room on the end could be called a large room, but the word large does not denote the final size of the room discovered.<n>I believe that E: treasure is also not correct because the discovery of the room does not mean the discovery of the treasure.  The room could, and often times is, used to hide the treasure.<n>I believe that A: public building is also incorrect because there is no evidence that the passageway led to any sort of public building.<n>Similarly, B: tomb and C: arena do not make sense because they suggest that the room contained a deceased person or a deceased person's belongings. The explorers found the room itself, but in this case, it can only be assumed that the room contained no skeletons, or bodies, or tombs, etc.<n>I believe that the correct answer is B: tomb

If it begins with a vowel, that makes a difference!<n>Output :  It means that these expressions are
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Output: 1. First, the question suggests that John did everything that was required of him while examining the corpse.<n>2. The text also suggests that despite doing everything that was required, he still missed the real cause of death.<n>3. Given this context, John's examination was not lacking in care, thought, completeness, or intricacy as these are not necessarily related to missing information.<n>4. However, the examination missing the real cause of death suggests that it wasn't comprehensive or detailed enough.<n>5. In this context, being 'thorough' implies that he would have taken more time to carefully check every aspect of the examination.<n>6. Therefore, D: thorough is the correct answer. The missing element in John's examination was thoroughness. Had he been more thorough, he would have discovered the real cause of death.<n>So the final answer is D: thorough<n><n>Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n>Output:		D:coastal area<n>Answer:D<n><n>Input:How would you define the term 'protagonist' if it weren't defined in the dictionary? Choices: A: hero B: story C: antagonist D: villain E: none of the above<n>Output:C: antagonist<n>Answer:A<n><n>Input:The word for 'father' in the word ladder below is:? --->? --->?<n>Choices: A: son B: mother C: grandmother D: maternal grandfather E: grandfather fathers sons mothers grandmothers<n>Output:C:grandmother<n>Answer:C<n><n>Input:Is my life a joke? Choices: A. Yes, in your head.  B. Yes, it is. C. Maybe. D. You are not the centre of the universe. E. You look ridiculous.<n>Output:E. You look ridiculou<n>Answer:C<n>

In this context, the question doesn't suggest that any of the choices can be a result of seeing clouds above.<n>4. However the text suggests one can experience dullness in the eyes i.e. go blind after seeing the clouds.<n>5. This is something that would affect your eyes, which could lead to you experiencing either a dull or wet experience.<n>6. However, seeing the clouds and then experiencing dullness or wetness wouldn't necessitate dullness or wetting that would cause such experiences. Given this context, the answer choice is C: dull. Dullness is related with seeing the clouds.<n><n>Input:When you go out in a bright sunny day,it is always nice to keep sunglasses with you. In this context, there are more possibilities to get sick after going out in a sunny bright weather and not wearing sunglass.<n>3. Thus, D: you might catch cold is the correct one.  This is one of the possibilities.<n>

When a snake prefers a warm, sunny weather then it would live in 'new mexico' because it is located in the North American Southwest on the arid high desert plateau. (2.) The answer is C: white house because White House is known for its warm, sunny weather.<n>So the final Answer is C: white house<n><n># Instruction<n><n># Import the necessary packages & set the global_vars<n><n>import re<n>from collections import defaultdict<n><n>current_question=None<n>current_options=None<n>current_answer=None<n><n># Instruction:Initialize the main variable, which is an dictionary<n><n>main_dict=defaultdict(list)<n><n># Instruction : read the first question<n><n>main_file= open('../data/data.txt')<n><n>for line in main_file:<n>    if re.match(r"^.*\s*(Choice:.*):\s*(Answer:.*)$", line, re.IGNORECASE):<n>        choice = line.upper().replace("CHOICE:","").replace("ANSWER:","").lower()<n>        current_question=choice<n>        if choice in ['WHICH A:'],['WHICH A: '],['WHICH A ]:',['WHICH A' ']'], :<n>            current_options = re.split(r"\s*([\w\s]+\.[\w])", line)<n><n>        if re.match(":",line):<n>            current_dict = main_dict<n>            main_dict=defaultdict()<n>        else :<n>            main_dict.update({current_question:current_options})<n>        # print choice<n>        # print current_options<n>        # print current question<n>        # print current answer<n># print main_dict<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him. First, the question suggests that John did everything that was required of him while examining the corpse.<n>2. The text also suggests that despite doing everything that was required, he still missed the real cause of death.<n>3. Given this context, John's examination was not lacking in care, thought, completeness, or intricacy as these are not necessarily related to missing information.<n>4. However, the examination missing the real cause of death suggests that it wasn't comprehensive or detailed enough.<n>5. In this context, being 'thorough' implies that he would have taken more time to carefully check every aspect of the examination.<n>6. Therefore, D: thorough is the correct answer. The missing element in John's examination was thoroughness. Had he been more thorough, he would have discovered the real cause of death.<n>So the final answer is D: thorough<n><n>Input:The man set the cup on the table.  It didn't matter. This infers that he couldn't throw down anything heavy enough to balance the cup. Therefore, the correct answer choice is B: HANDS.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him. Had he been more thorough, he would have discovered the real cause of death.<n>So the final answer is D: thorough<n><n>Input:You might head to the locker room after getting a green drink here. Choices:  A: health club B: jocks C: fitness centre D: stadium E: gymnasium<n>Output:		1.[Green drink][head to][locker room][After], from a top down, logical parsing order.<n>2. The "to" in "head to" is implied in the sentence but is grammatically incorrect. Therefore, the text should follow "head to" with "locker room" to ensure correct usage of "to".<n>3. "Green drink" implies health or wellness as "health club" is a common term for fitness centers that focus on healthy living.<n>4. "After" implies that "green drink" comes after it, as it is in the same clause as "head to".<n>5. Therefore, "Green drink[head to][locker_room][After]" from a bottom up, logical parsing order is true.<n>So the final sentence is C: Health club.[Green drink][head][to][locker room][after].<n><n>Input: A. He never returned home. B. The police have a suspect, though, and are hunting for the man. C. All that's left is dust and ghosts. D. I'm scared to think what he wants from me. E. I've lived half my life. F. There's no other option now. G. It's too late to leave. H. It's always too late to leave. I. He's been stalking me forever. J. I'm afraid. Output<n>Output:<n>1. The man was stalking the main character for years.  He never returned home, the police do not know who the man was, and he left very little behind- just dust and ghosts.  The main character was scared, and it was too late for her to leave or go anywhere else.  All of this is a result of being stalked.  After she moved away and stopped telling her new friend what the old friend wanted from her, she was able to stop being scared.  However, the main character says that the old friend has been stalking her for "forever" so the effect of the relationship on the main character was a long and ongoing one.<n><n>2. First, the author is describing their new friends.  They are saying they haven't lived half their lives because they were just now finding new friends.<n>3. Second, the author is showing that the new friends is describing her old friends. In the first
